name: Gimbap
description: Cooked rice and ingredients (vegetables, fish, meat) rolled in gim (dried sheets of seaweed)

name: Naengmyeon
description: Korean icy cold noodle dish which consists of long and thing handmade buckwheat noodles, topped with egg and cucumber

name: Bossam
description: Boiled pork dish (pork shoulder); served with spicy radish kimchi, garlic, ssamjang, and lettuce

name: Jjajangmyeon
description: Korean-chinese noodle dish topped with thich sauce made of chunjang, diced pork, vegtables (cucumber), and an egg

name: Japchae
description: Savory and and slighty sweet stir-fried glass noodle dish, combined with vegetables and optional add on: pork meat

name: Kongguksu
description: Noodle dish in cold soybean milk soup; can be done in either sweet or savory

name: Hobakjuk
description: Sweet pumpkim porridge made with pumpkin and house-made glutinous rice flour balls

name: Bulgogi
description: Literally translates to: fire meat; Thin marinated slices of beef grilled on barbecue for smokey taste, served on top of cooked white rice

name: Bibimbap
description: Bowl of warm white rice topped with vegetables, kimchi, gochujang paste, soy sauce, and sesame oil

name: Kimchi
description: Traditional side dish of salted and fermented napa cabbage

name: Tteokbokki
description: Korean street food made with rice cakes and vegetables in spicy gochujang sauce

name: Gopchang
description: Beef tripe hot pot; spicy korean stew made with cooked beef trip, vegetables, and seasoning in beef broth
